system.description:
Tectonomancer

ALSO: Earth Mage, Stoneshaper, Terramancer

A Tectonomancer wields magic that manipulates the living earth. Whether they got their start with rocks and dirt or they’re an Elementalist who later specialized, nobody can doubt their expertise now.

Tectonomancy encourages a deliberate, almost ponderous approach to problem-solving, but not all practitioners are willing to take it slow. Those who last the longest recognize that it is best not to be reckless when calling upon such a dreadfully powerful and destructive art. After all, even the mightiest castle needs a foundation to stand on.

TECTONOMANCER FREE BENEFITS

  • Permanently increase your maximum Hit Points by 5.

  • You may perform Rituals whose effects fall within the Elementalism discipline. As long as they work with Earth, Metal or Living Wood.

  • Masterying Tectonomancer qualifies you to take the Powerful Spell Heroic Skills.

TECTONOMANCER SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.zh4aSUXfN0gddzJj]{Earthmeld} (SL2)

At 【SL 1】 you have the ability to move through solid stone and dirt without disturbing it. If solid ground is available, you may use an action and spend 1 Fabula Point to sink into it to take cover for the rest of a scene. You will have to emerge from the earth nearby.

At 【SL 2】 you can take willing creatures with you a short distance - through a wall or rockfall, for instance. (If you release a creature, the magic launches them to the surface in an unpredictable direction; you can’t trap them, though you could try this as an unconventional travel method.)

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.xp1Csz7LczIW8Zoc]{Tectonomancy} (SL10)

Each time you acquire this Skill, learn one Elementalist spell (see next three pages).
Offensive (@ICON[offensive]) Tectonomancer spells use 【INS + WLP】 for the Magic Check.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.iWV0UGI9HiDPfmVa]{Mineral Spirit}

When you use the Inventory action to create a Tonic, the creature that drinks it recovers from all status effects, instead of just one.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.DHavgDFfytd17Ze3]{Solid Path} (SL3)

You are immune to environmental effects that would affect you via dangerous ground (for example, marshy ground inflicting slow or unstable footing filling a clock towards an avalanche.)

The GM is the final arbiter on what counts. You may extend this benefit to other creatures for the rest of a scene by spending 【20 - (5*SL)】MP for each creature.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.mbuSMM9ZMFdoddEK]{Stonework}

You always have the tools you need to work stone or metal - even types you’ve never seen before - without spending Inventory Points. Additionally, whenever you fill in or erase a segment of a clock related to building, reinforcing, or destroying a structure made of stone, metal, or living wood, you may fill in or erase an additional segment.
